curam.util.client.domain.render

Class AbstractDomainRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.render.AbstractDomainRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainRenderer, ComponentRenderer<Field>, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractEditRenderer, AbstractSelectRenderer, AbstractViewRenderer

    public abstract class AbstractDomainRenderer
extends AbstractDomainPlugIn
implements DomainRenderer
    An abstract superclass for domain-specific field component renderers. When writing new renderers, you should use an existing renderer class or the AbstractEditRenderer, AbstractSelectRenderer or AbstractViewRenderer classes as the base class. Do not extend this class directly.

      • setScriptAttributes

        protected void setScriptAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                   Field field)
        Sets the various script event handling attributes of the element from the parameters of the field.
        Parameters:

        element - The element on which to set the attributes.

      • getCodeTableName

        protected java.lang.String getCodeTableName(Domain domain)
                                     throws ClientException
        Gets the name of the code-table associated with a domain. Throws an exception if the domain is not a client domain, is not associated with a code-table, or has a null or empty code-table name.
        Parameters:
        domain - The domain whose code-table name is required. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The name of the code-table used by the field's domain.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the code-table name cannot be determined.

      • isWidthUnitsPercent

        protected boolean isWidthUnitsPercent(Field field)
        Determines whether WIDTH_UNITS is set to PERCENT or not.
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose width style is required.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the WIDTH_UNITS attribute equals to "PERCENT".

      • getWidth

        protected java.lang.String getWidth(Field field)
        Gets the CSS width string that specifies the width for the field based on the values of the field's "WIDTH" and "WIDTH_UNITS" parameters. The value can be used as the value of the CSS width style for the HTML element associated with the field. If the "WIDTH" field parameter is not set or is set to zero, null is returned. If "WIDTH" is set to "auto", that is used and "WIDTH_UNITS" is ignored. If "WIDTH_UNITS" is not set or set to "PERCENT", then a percentage width is defined, otherwise the units will be "ch".
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose width style is required.
        Returns:
        The CSS width value to apply to the HTML element for the field, or null if no width was defined for the field.

      • getWidthStyle

        protected java.lang.String getWidthStyle(Field field)
        Gets the CSS style string that specifies the width for the field based on the values of the field's "WIDTH" and "WIDTH_UNITS" parameters. The value can be used as the value of the HTML style attribute for the HTML element associated with the field. If the "WIDTH" field parameter is not set or is set to zero, null is returned. If "WIDTH" is set to "auto", that is used and "WIDTH_UNITS" is ignored. If "WIDTH_UNITS" is not set or set to "PERCENT", then a percentage width is defined, otherwise the units will be "ch".
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose width style is required.
        Returns:
        The CSS style to apply to the HTML element for the field, or null if no width was defined for the field.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle(Field field,
                                 DataAccessor dataAccessor)
                          throws DataAccessException
        Gets the title that can be used to identify the field on the web page. The title will be the first non-null value taken, in order, from the title Text object, the title string, or the LABEL parameter of the field.
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose label is to be rendered.
        dataAccessor - DataAccessor to be used to resolve the paths in the Text. This parameter is not mandatory. Specific implementations will throw a DataAccessException where its mandatory.
        Returns:
        The title, or null if none was available.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if there is a problem resolving the title Text.

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel(Field field,
                                 DataAccessor dataAccessor)
                          throws DataAccessException
        Gets the label that can be used to identify the field on the web page.
        Parameters:
        field - The field whose label is to be rendered. Text.
        dataAccessor - DataAccessor to be used to resolve the paths in the Text. This parameter is not mandatory. Specific implementations will throw a DataAccessException where its mandatory.
        Returns:
        The label, or null if none was available.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - if there is a problem resolving the title Text.

      • setSrcOnImgElement

        public void setSrcOnImgElement(org.w3c.dom.Element img,
                               java.lang.String imgPath)
                        throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to an image as the value of the src attribute on the specified HTML img element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to an image will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        img - The specified image element
        imgPath - The specified path to the image. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified image cannot be set specified on the specified image element.

      • setSrcOnElement

        public static void setSrcOnElement(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                   java.lang.String resourcePath)
                            throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to a resource as the value of the src attribute on the specified HTML element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to a resource will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        element - The specified element
        resourcePath - The specified path to a resource. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified resource cannot be set specified as the specified src attribute on the specified element.

      • setHrefOnElement

        public static void setHrefOnElement(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                    java.lang.String resourcePath)
                             throws ClientException
        Sets the specified path to a resource as the value of the href attribute on the specified HTML element. If a static content server is configured then the specified path to a resource will be set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        element - The specified element
        resourcePath - The specified path to a resource. Paths that start with ../ are valid.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the specified resource cannot be set specified as the specified href attribute on the specified element.

      • isCSRFTokenGenerationEnabled

        protected static boolean isCSRFTokenGenerationEnabled()
        Checks if enhanced CSRF protection has been enabled -- token based CSRF mitigation.
        Returns:
        a boolean which is set to true if CSRF token validation should be enabled.

      • includeCarbonComponent

        protected void includeCarbonComponent(RendererContext context,
                                      java.lang.String elementID,
                                      java.lang.String labels,
                                      java.lang.String messages,
                                      java.lang.String carbonFunction,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> addtionalConfig)
                               throws DataAccessException
        Includes the specific carbon component on the page by invoking the name of the JavaScript function and passing in the arguments to it.
        Parameters:
        context - The renderer context.
        elementID - The ID of the DOM node that this Carbon component will be attached to.
        labels - A string of labels that can be used for translation in Carbon component.
        messages - A string of messages that can be used for translation of error messages within the Carbon component.
        carbonFunction - The JavaScript Carbon function which will be used to instantiate the Carbon component.
        addtionalConfig - An optional map of key vale pairs to be passed as extra parameters to the Carbon JavaScript invocation.
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - If there is an issue accessing some date configuration.
